title: Easthaven Ferry - Duergar Outpost
description: Hidden duergar base under Easthaven's ferry. Durth Sunblight's operation for chardalyn theft throughout Ten-Towns. Contains map to Sunblight Fortress location. Opportunity for investigation and intelligence gathering about larger duergar conspiracy. Could be discovered through Zhentarim spy network.

title: Xardorok Sunblight - Duergar Warlord
description: Paranoid duergar warlord obsessed with chardalyn. Building massive chardalyn dragon to destroy Ten-Towns. Head of Sunblight clan in fortress in Spine of the World. Devout follower of Deep Duerra. Killed most of his own family through paranoia and violence. Two surviving sons: Durth and Nildar (both sent on distant missions). Supernatural patron drives his conquest ambitions - connects to Auril's influence rather than Asmodeus.

title: Grandolpha Muzgardt - Duergar Rebel
description: Duergar matriarch secretly opposing Xardorok's plans. Once wooed by Xardorok with promises of marriage and wealth, now sees his madness. Potential ally in Sunblight Fortress. Commands loyalty from some duergar who question Xardorok's increasingly destructive obsessions. Key to creating internal faction conflict within fortress.

title: Durth Sunblight - Duergar Son
description: One of Xardorok's two surviving sons. Operates from Easthaven Ferry, sending duergar to steal chardalyn from nearby towns. Has map showing location of Sunblight Fortress. Could be captured/interrogated for information. Potential for interesting family dynamics if confronted with father's madness.

title: Nildar Sunblight - Duergar Son
description: Xardorok's other surviving son. Sent on distant mission to keep him away from court. Could be encountered separately or used as leverage against Xardorok. Another angle for exploring duergar family tragedy and Xardorok's paranoid destruction of his own bloodline.

title: Klondorn - Corrupted Priest
description: Duergar priest of Deep Duerra serving as Xardorok's advisor. Actually feeds him information from supernatural patron (connect to Auril/Auriliths rather than Asmodeus). Creates magical constructs in temple using red dragon heart forge. Key to understanding how Xardorok receives his 'divine inspiration.'

title: Vellynne Harpell - Arcane Brotherhood Wizard
description: Necromancer from Arcane Brotherhood searching for Ythryn. Could offer aid against chardalyn dragon with undead direwolf sleds for rapid travel. Potential ally but with her own agenda seeking ancient Netherese magic. Creates opportunity for party to learn about larger magical conspiracy.

title: Sunblight Fortress - Duergar Stronghold
description: Three-level duergar fortress in Spine of the World. Top level: massive doors for dragon exit. Middle level: living quarters, Grandolpha's faction. Bottom level: forge with red dragon heart, construction hall, throne room, temple to Deep Duerra. About 30 rooms total. Faction dynamics between loyalists and rebels create infiltration opportunities.

title: The Black Cabin - Cursed Location
description: Cabin where travelers die mysterious deaths. Connected to cursed magic items and chardalyn corruption. Good location for horror-themed encounter that reinforces deadly nature of Icewind Dale. Could contain chardalyn-corrupted items that tie to larger corruption network.

title: Cackling Chasm - Underground Passage
description: Underground route providing alternative access to various locations. Natural formation with unique dangers including unstable ice and strange acoustics. Useful for travel between areas or as escape route. Could connect to other Underdark passages leading to Sunblight.

title: The White Moose - Corrupted Beast
description: Awakened moose corrupted by periapt of wound closure. Attacks loggers in Lonelywood forest. Led by frost druid villain seeking revenge against civilization. Connection to nature magic corruption theme. Could tie to Circle Shiverveil/Blackgleam firbolg knowledge of natural balance disruption.

title: A Beautiful Mine - Termalaine Quest
description: Kobolds have taken over gem mine in Termalaine. Involves negotiation with kobold chieftain Hrark. Mine produces precious gems valuable for trade. Could become party asset if handled diplomatically. Good early-level quest with multiple solutions - combat, negotiation, or trickery.

title: Mountain Climb - Yeti Investigation
description: Investigation into missing climbers on Kelvin's Cairn. Leads to yeti encounters and potentially discovers goliath settlements like Skytower Shelter. Could reveal information about supernatural activity in mountains. Ties to both survival themes and larger mysteries. Good tie-in for Keogr's background.

title: Holed Up - Winter Wolf Encounter
description: Winter wolves have cornered travelers in Dougan's Hole area. Opportunity for negotiation or combat. Winter wolves can provide information about supernatural winter if approached correctly. Tests party's problem-solving skills and understanding of natural vs supernatural threats.

title: Black Swords Cult - Caer Dineval
description: Cult following Levistus in Caer Dineval. Wears black ice amulets (similar to Huarwar's black ice shard!). Led by cultists who worship devil of frozen lake. Perfect tie-in to existing chardalyn corruption theme. Could be connected to tiefling recruiters who took Huarwar.

title: The Unseen - Invisible Stalker Mystery
description: Invisible stalker murdering people in Caer-Konig. Summoned by bitter mage seeking revenge. Investigation leads to duergar connection and information about larger conspiracy. Good mystery for party to solve using investigation skills rather than just combat.

title: Chardalyn Dragon - Doomsday Weapon
description: Massive construct dragon built by Xardorok from chardalyn. Programmed to destroy each Ten-Towns settlement in sequence: Dougan's Hole → Good Mead → Easthaven → Caer-Dineval → Caer-Konig → Termalaine → Lonelywood → Bremen → Targos → Bryn Shander. Creates ultimate time pressure and represents escalation of chardalyn corruption threat.

title: Duergar Chardalyn Network
description: Organized duergar operation stealing chardalyn from throughout Ten-Towns. Multiple cells operating from hidden bases (Easthaven Ferry, possibly others). Connects to existing chardalyn corruption theme. Could be working with/manipulated by Auriliths rather than devils. Explains spread of black ice artifacts.

title: Chardalyn Corruption Effects
description: Extended exposure to chardalyn causes paranoia, madness, and violent tendencies. CON saves DC 15 after each day of contact, failure causes personality changes toward aggression. Fits perfectly with black ice shard corruption theme. Characters handling chardalyn items risk becoming like Huarwar.

title: Fortress Siege Mechanics
description: Time pressure during Sunblight infiltration. Dragon launch creates 2-day countdown to Ten-Towns destruction. Travel times: Sunblight to Dougan's Hole (15.5 hours), between towns (varies). Balances exploration with narrative urgency. Party must choose: stop Xardorok or chase dragon.

title: Construct Creation Rituals
description: How duergar create chardalyn constructs using temple rituals and red dragon heart forge. Magic circles channel Deep Duerra's power through Klondorn's rituals. Could be adapted for other chardalyn corruption processes. Destroying dragon heart forge cripples construct creation.

title: Red Dragon Heart Forge
description: Beating heart of ancient red dragon powers Sunblight's forge. Allows creation of powerful constructs like chardalyn dragon. Located in lowest level forge room. Destroying it cripples duergar construct production. Heavily guarded and magically warded. Key target for disrupting Xardorok's plans.

title: Aurilith-Duergar Connection
description: Theory: Auriliths are manipulating Xardorok instead of devils. His 'supernatural patron' could be one of the seven Auriliths psychically influencing him to create chardalyn dragon. This would unify the chardalyn corruption, Aurilith influence, and duergar threat into single conspiracy. Creates stronger narrative connection.

title: Hrark - Kobold Chieftain
description: Kobold leader who took over gem mine in Termalaine. Clever negotiator who can be reasoned with. Wants security for his tribe during harsh winter. Could become ally if party helps establish kobold-human trade relationship. Provides alternative to combat resolution in Beautiful Mine quest.

title: Frost Druid - White Moose Controller
description: Unnamed frost druid controlling the White Moose. Seeks revenge against loggers and civilization. Uses corrupted awakened animals as weapons. Could be connected to larger druidic corruption or Auril worship. Represents nature's violent response to the endless winter.

title: Chardalyn Dragon Attack Timeline
description: Precise timing of dragon's destructive path through Ten-Towns. Each town gets 2-4 hours of destruction before dragon moves on. Total attack takes ~48 hours. Party has limited time to intercept at specific towns. Creates difficult tactical decisions about which settlements can be saved.

title: Wurther - Zhentarim Spy in Bremen
description: Lawful evil human spy posing as humble fisherman. One of Naerth's 12+ Zhentarim agents throughout Ten-Towns. Keeps low profile, gathers intelligence on Bremen's struggling economy and Speaker Shalescar's mental decline. Reports back via Naerth's flying snakes. Potential to recruit desperate locals or exploit town's vulnerabilities for Black Network expansion.

title: Food, Water & Survival
description: No food: CON save DC 15 after 5 days, then daily (+1 DC each day). No water: CON save DC 15 after 1 day. Failure = 2 exhaustion levels. Foraging: Survival DC 15 (varies by terrain). Extreme cold increases caloric needs.

title: Falling Through Ice Rules
description: Breaking through ice: 1d6 cold damage + frigid water exhaustion save. Climbing out: Athletics DC 15 (wet clothes = disadvantage). Each round in water: CON save DC 15 or gain exhaustion. Wet clothes in extreme cold = disadvantage on cold saves for 1 hour.

title: Exhaustion Levels Reference
description: 1: Disadvantage ability checks. 2: Speed halved. 3: Disadvantage attacks/saves. 4: HP max halved. 5: Speed reduced to 0. 6: Death. Removed by long rest (1 level) or lesser/greater restoration. CRITICAL for cold survival tracking.

title: Visibility & Weather Effects
description: Heavy snow/blizzard: heavily obscured beyond 5ft (blind condition). Light snow: lightly obscured (disadvantage Perception). Bright snow: snow blindness, CON save DC 15 or temporary blindness. Tracking in snow: Survival advantages/disadvantages vary.

title: Difficult Terrain & Movement
description: Difficult terrain (snow, ice, rubble): costs 2 feet movement per 1 foot traveled. Climbing icy surfaces: Athletics DC varies (10-20). Prone on ice: Athletics/Acrobatics DC 10 to stand without falling. Thin ice breaks on failed DEX save.

title: Frigid Water & Drowning
description: Frigid water: CON save DC 15 or gain 1 exhaustion (cold shock). Drowning: hold breath for CON mod + 1 minutes (min 30 sec). After that, survive CON mod rounds before dropping to 0 HP and dying. Swimming in armor = disadvantage on STR checks.

title: Extreme Cold Weather Rules
description: Extreme cold (below 0°F): CON save DC 10 every hour, +1 DC each hour. Failure = 1 level exhaustion. Warm clothing/heat sources = advantage. Cold resistance = automatic success. Exhaustion kills at level 6. Icewind Dale averages -49°F.

title: Tiefling Recruiters - Black Swords
description: Male and female tieflings who recruited Huarwar. Wore amulets matching his black ice shard. Offered sanctuary at their castle (Caer-Dineval). Connected to Black Swords cult. Actively recruiting corrupted individuals with chardalyn artifacts.

title: Black Ice Shard - Corruption Artifact
description: Mysterious black ice shard found by Huarwar during Speaker search. Changed his personality from kind to mean/threatening. Tieflings wore matching amulets. Connected to Black Swords cult at Caer-Dineval. Chardalyn corruption spreading through artifacts?

title: Huarwar Mulphoon - Corrupted Son
description: Cora's adult son, joined search party for Speaker Shalescar two months ago. Got separated, returned with frostbite and BLACK ICE SHARD. Became mean/threatening toward mother (uncharacteristic). Two TIEFLINGS with matching amulets offered him sanctuary at their castle. Left willingly, took shard, said he'd never return. Now at Caer-Dineval keep with Black Swords cult.

title: Cora Mulphoon - Buried Treasure Innkeeper
description: Neutral good human commoner, middle-aged innkeeper. Eager to please, apologizes constantly fearing guests displeasure. Barely making ends meet but treats guests like royalty. Lost her only child Huarwar two months ago to mysterious tieflings after he found BLACK ICE SHARD.

title: Bremen - Buried Treasure Inn
description: Inn catering to treasure-seekers who pan riverbank in warmer weather. Few/no visitors during winter. Run by middle-aged Cora Mulphoon who treats guests like royalty while barely making ends meet.

title: Owenn Tarsenel - Luskan Arms Proprietor
description: Neutral human commoner, quiet balding man in deep depression. Fears summer will never return. Runs The Luskan Arms inn where Naerth Maxildanarr stays in the largest suite.

title: 'Ma' Ethen Yarbroul - Three Flags Sailing Owner
description: Neutral good human commoner, plump gray-haired widow with grandmotherly demeanor. Runs fisherman's tavern Three Flags Sailing. Good source for rumors and local fishing community gossip.

title: Jestin Hunrae - Triglio Proprietor
description: Neutral good human commoner, scarecrow-like appearance. Ex-fisherman with crushed left hand from collision with Termalaine boat. Runs general goods store but doesn't sell fishing/sailing supplies (specialty crafters handle those). Sells common gear including fishing poles and snowshoes.

title: Targos Key Locations
description: Town Hall (government center). Triglio (general goods except fishing/sailing). Three Flags Sailing (fisherman's tavern, rumors). The Luskan Arms (inn where Naerth stays). Specialty fishing/sailing suppliers separate from general goods.

title: Boat Hire Option
description: 10gp per person to hire boat for river crossing. Could use skill challenge format. Represents safest but most expensive option for wealthy parties.

title: Safe Route - Riverbed Hike
description: 8+ hour hike along riverbed and around dangerous crossing. Includes random encounter opportunity. Safer but much longer route. Time vs safety decision for party.

title: Shaengarne River Crossing Challenge
description: 200ft wide mostly frozen river. Difficult terrain requiring INDIVIDUAL Survival DC 14 checks to avoid thin ice. Failure = DC 10 DEX save or fall through. Alternative: skill challenge format. 'Ice seems to lie in wait, howling wind through Drowned Choir raising tension.' Cannot see across river but know others have made this trip.

title: Targos to Bremen - Travel Options
description: Light snow conditions (vision reduced to 100ft). Party WILL see Yll-Varn the Drowned Choir. Two routes: 3-hour dangerous river crossing OR 8+ hour safe riverbed hike. Boat hire available for 10gp/person. Creates tactical decision about risk vs time.

title: Mountain Climb Quest Introduction
description: Introduce Mountain Climb quest when party returns to Targos after visiting Bremen and/or Termalaine. Timing allows party to build relationships before major quest reveal.

title: Targos Humanoid Sacrifices
description: Targos has escalated to HUMANOID sacrifices to Auril - most extreme of all Ten-Towns. This could be Naerth/Zhentarim manipulation to create fear and consolidate power, or genuine desperation from largest population. Creates moral urgency for party intervention.

title: Skath - Zhentarim Militia Commander
description: Lawful evil tiefling veteran, leads Targos militia. Loyal to Speaker Naerth Maxildanarr. Commands 200 soldiers + 16 veterans - largest military force in Ten-Towns. Zhentarim enforcer ensuring Naerth's control over town and trade routes.

title: Targos - In a Nutshell
description:
Friendliness ❄❄ Services ❄❄❄ Comfort ❄❄ 
Population: 1,000 (largest town). 
Leaders: Speaker Naerth Maxildanarr (LE human spy, secret Zhentarim), Skath (LE tiefling veteran) leads militia. 
Militia: 200 soldiers + 16 veterans (strongest force). 
Heraldry: Single-sailed black ship on light blue field. 
Sacrifice to Auril: HUMANOID. 
Rivals: Bremen, Lonelywood, Termalaine.

title: Bremen Military & Heraldry
description: Militia: 25 soldiers (tribal warrior stats) + 2 veterans. Heraldry: Gold circle on white field, horizontal blue band left (Shaengarne River), flaring blue triangle right (Maer Dualdon). Gold circle = treasure from local floods, white field = snow. Small but organized defense force.

title: Speaker Dorbulgruf Shalescar - Addled Elder
description: Lawful good shield dwarf commoner, Bremen's Speaker. Age has addled his mind - vacant-eyed stare often mistaken for unflappable calmness. TWICE in past two months residents mounted search parties, found him wandering frozen Shaengarne shores in heavy furs with NO MEMORY of how he got there. Old even by dwarf standards, not long for this world. Locals fear same is true of Bremen if winter doesn't abate.

title: Bremen - in a Nutshell
description:
Friendliness ❄❄❄ Services ❄ Comfort ❄❄ 
Available Quest: Lake Monster. 
Population: 150. 
Leader: Speaker Dorbulgruf Shalescar (lawful good shield dwarf commoner) 
Rivals: Lonelywood, Targos, Termalaine.

title: Lake Monster Quest
description: The lake monster's den is inside the Drowned Choir. Luck roll. If bad luck, they will have to follow it there to confront it.

title: Zhentarim Network in Ten-Towns
description:
Naerth commands 12+ Zhentarim spies across Ten-Towns including Wurther (Bremen fisherman spy). Active operations: disposing of suspected Harper spies, convincing business owners to buy fish exclusively from Targos. Goal is transforming Ten-Towns into Black Network trade hub. Creates faction conflict and espionage subplot throughout campaign. 

They have begun humanoid sacrifices, which is why Yll-Varn is following their bidding to attack Bremen.

title: Speaker Naerth Maxildanarr - Zhentarim Leader
description: Former Luskan rogue, moved to Targos couple years ago. Took residence in Luskan Arms largest suite, spread gold around earning fisher loyalty. Cordial, down-to-earth demeanor. Replaced well-liked Speaker who didn't want job. SECRETLY: Head of Zhentarim in Ten-Towns, wants to make it trade hub for Black Network. Commands 12+ Zhentarim spies throughout Ten-Towns, disposing Harper spies and convincing businesses to buy Targos fish over competitors. Uses THREE FLYING SNAKES in his room to deliver messages to spies.

title: Targos - Frozen Harbor & Musical Winds
description: Wooden wall extends into Maer Dualdon creating safe harbor, now frozen solid trapping boats in ice. Fishers drag smaller vessels across ice to reach unfrozen water beyond walls. Biggest fishing fleet/industry in Ten-Towns, everything revolves around knucklehead trout fishing. Distinct musicality in air - wind blowing through large pipes of ever-shifting size (connected to Yll-Varn the Drowned Choir?).

title: Chwinga Mask Doodles - Subconscious Connection
description: Korux unconsciously drew mask patterns (matching Chwinga mask found on her body) throughout journal margins, along with crack patterns. Suggests psychic connection between Chwinga activity, mirror entity influence, and Sephek's victims. Victims may be marked/influenced before death.

title: Sephek's Stalking Pattern
description: Korux's final entry describes 'figure near sleds. Too tall. Too thin. Made of ice. Waiting for me.' This shows Sephek stalks victims before killing them, appearing as an unnatural ice figure. Suggests he may have been watching the party's dwarf rescue mission.

title: Corrupted Ice - Unnatural Properties
description: Ice in Icewind Dale 'doesn't melt right' - leaves vein-like lines and seems to watch where people walk. This suggests the winter curse has fundamentally altered the nature of ice itself. Could be connected to chardalyn corruption or Auril's influence seeping into the environment.

title: The Mirror Entity - Dream Manipulator
description: Mysterious entity appearing in Korux's dreams through mirrors. Demands impossible moral choices (treasure vs friend). When questioned about being a god, it cracks instead of answering. Connected to Ishkar the Silver Mirror Aurilith? Could be how Auriliths psychically influence victims before Sephek arrives.

title: Gorga's Journal - Mirror Visions & Sephek Encounter
description: Journal from dead dwarf (Gorga Snowjaw) killed by Sephek in Session 1. Spans 1 month before death. Key entries: Dreams of mirror watching her, ice that 'doesn't melt right' with vein-like lines, mirror demanding choice between treasure/friend, final entry about tall thin figure made of ice waiting by sleds. Margins filled with mask doodles (like Chwinga mask found on body) and crack patterns. Last 2 pages are bland logkeeping.

title: Carved Snowflake - Spirit Key Item
description: Key item left by Whisperkin chwinga after successful first contact. Acts as spiritual key to later encounters. Physical proof of chwinga alliance and opens communication with other spirits throughout campaign.

title: Chwinga Trial - Choose Your Side
description: Optional encounter in glade/old druid circle. Party asked wordlessly (via illusion/emotion) to choose: uphold balance or give in to cold? Trial determines how spirits help/hinder rest of quest. Major moral decision affecting campaign direction.

title: Fey Echoes - Chwinga-Led Investigation
description: Whisperkin lead PCs to other sites: more Sephek victims OR ancient frost circles with old chwinga markings. Some clues distorted/altered by Frostlings trying to protect Sephek. Creates investigation dynamic with helpful/harmful spirits.

title: First Chwinga Contact Encounter
description: PCs see chwinga mimicking their actions (brushing snow, lighting fire, casting motions). Successful social interaction or being still/respectful causes chwinga to leave CARVED SNOWFLAKE. This becomes key to later spirit encounters.

title: 🧊 The Frostlings (Chaotic Chwinga)
description: Grey/black masks (icicles/bone shapes). Mischievous/aggressive - mess with gear, erase tracks, mislead PCs. WORSHIP SEPHEK as 'Chosen of Winter' or 'Spirit of Death' and try to protect him. Use illusions/riddles to delay/derail the hunt.

title: ❄️ The Whisperkin (Helpful Chwinga)
description: Soft blue/white chwinga with swirling snowflake masks. Leave gifts: shiny rocks, warm food, helpful potions. One has SEEN SEPHEK and tries to guide PCs to truth. Fond of characters who respect nature (especially Mama Chrys druid and Joosep ranger). Pro-balance faction.

title: Chwinga Factions - The Mystery Revealed
description: The 'tiny people dancing on corpses' are CHWINGA! Two opposing factions exist in Icewind Dale, creating complex moral dynamics around Sephek's murders and the winter curse.

title: Session 1 Rumor Mill Opportunities
description: Need to develop rumors about: humanoid sacrifices, speculation on Auriliths, murders with witnesses seeing tiny people dancing on corpses, plus backstory-connected rumors for each PC. Northlook Inn perfect setting for information gathering.

title: Clan Battlehammer Iron Trade Connection
description: Dwarves still maintaining trade routes despite winter. Clan Battlehammer specifically transporting iron to Bryn Shander. Party now has dwarf friendship - could be important for Mithral Hall connections and Regis ruby quest later.

title: Bryn Shander Key Locations
description: Blackiron Blades (cheap adventuring gear, party has 10% discount), House of the Morninglord (Amauntor shrine, Priest Mishann), Town Hall, Northlook Inn. 30ft walls with concentric wooden poles, gates closed during darkness (most of the time).

title: Sephek's Trading Caravan Arrival
description: Sephek will arrive in Bryn Shander with trading caravan next session. Opportunity for party to interact with him before knowing his true nature. Could establish him as friendly merchant before the horrifying reveal.

title: Tiny Gray Masks - Murder Evidence
description: Tiny gray masks found on Sephek's victims. First one found on Gorga Snowjaw's body.

title: Gorga Snowjaw - Murdered Artisan
description: Female dwarf artisan from Caer-Konig, killed by Sephek with icicle dagger for refusing Ishkar the Silver Mirror's psychic demands. Her journal reveals month-long torment by Ishkar appearing in her dreams through mirrors, demanding she sacrifice her father's treasured tankard - the most precious thing she owned. When she refused the Aurilith's test of devotion, asking 'what kind of god demands that,' Ishkar's mirror image cracked in her dreams. Days later, Sephek arrived as enforcement. Journal margins filled with unconscious doodles of masks and cracks, suggesting Ishkar's influence was affecting her subconscious. Her defiance of an Aurilith's will made her Sephek's target - first documented case of the Aurilith-Sephek enforcement pattern.

title: Foaming Mugs Quest - Dwarf Courier Rescue
description: Hruna, Korux, and Storn (Clan Battlehammer couriers) attacked by yeti while transporting iron. Party rescued them. Reward: 50gp gemstones each + 10% discount at Blackiron Blades + dwarf friendship. TWIST: Two corpses found - Oobok killed by yeti, but Gorga Snowjaw murdered with icicle dagger by Sephek.

title: Scramsax - Northlook Inn Proprietor
description: N human veteran, proprietor of Northlook Inn in Bryn Shander. Facilitates meeting between party and Wynnette. Cautious - warns 'never know who's watching.' Potential ally or information source.

title: The Drowned Choir's Deep Song
description: Yll-Varn sings to 'something deeper' in Maer Dualdon. What's beneath the lake responding to its call? Ancient entity, Auril's true form, or something else entirely? Musical/sonic encounter possibilities.

title: Ishkar's Precognitive Visions
description: Ishkar shows people committing future acts. Could be used for dramatic reveals, moral dilemmas, or as warnings. Potential for players to see themselves doing terrible things - are these fixed fate or possibilities to avoid?

title: Chardalyn Teeth - Virnax Connection
description: Virnax the Pale Maw has chardalyn teeth. This connects to the corrupted ruby theory - chardalyn corruption is spreading through Auril's servants/creations. Could be harvesting/corrupting magical materials.

title: Zethryn's Divided Influence on Shiverveil Clan
description: Zethryn whispers in Shiverveil firbolg dreams nightly, giving cryptic appeasement instructions while urging resistance/secrecy. Clan is divided: some think it's not Zethryn, others think it's Auril's trick, some believe Zethryn genuinely wants to end the curse. Creates internal clan conflict.

title: Uthessil the Warden in White (Caer Dineval)
description: Towering sentinel of smooth marble-white ice, arms ever outstretched. Said to carry away those who curse the Cold Lady (Auril) too loudly, even in jest. Enforces reverence through fear.

title: Ishkar the Silver Mirror (Caer Konig)
description: Jagged, angular Aurilith near Caer Konig that reflects not just image but intentions. Shows viewers committing acts they've never done—yet. Exerts influence through mirror-based dreams and psychological torture, appearing to victims in reflective surfaces to demand impossible moral choices. Ishkar tests devotion by demanding people sacrifice their most precious possessions or relationships. Those who refuse face escalating torment - mirrors crack in dreams, reflective surfaces show the Aurilith growing closer and more threatening. Victims report feeling watched through every mirror, window, or ice surface. When someone definitively refuses Ishkar's demands (like Gorga Snowjaw did), Sephek is dispatched as enforcement. Creates mirror phobia in those exposed to its influence - they must make WIS saves to look at reflective surfaces without fear.

title: Virnax the Pale Maw (Good Mead/Dougan's Hole)
description: Symbol: Toothy grin. Squat, wide-mouthed figure with chardalyn teeth. Children who wander too far hear 'a throat made of wind' calling their names. Child-targeting threat.

title: Zethryn the Root-Taker (Termalaine/Lonelywood)
description: Symbol: Upside-down tree. In copse of frozen-alive trees (green but frozen solid, don't sway). Stalagmite of ice with tree-trunk core, branch tendrils touching each frozen tree. Half-buried in clear ice, covered in crystalline moss-like growths. No humanoid qualities. Animals avoid area.

title: Karexil the Heatrobber (Easthaven)
description: Blackened by old fire and heatless flame, watches from ruins of old tower. Known to punish warmth and mercy. Appears where flame once bloomed. Anti-fire themed Aurilith.

title: Yll-Varn the Drowned Choir (Targos/Bremen)
description:
Partially submerged in Maer Dualdon. Blue-black ice tower on delicate arch (50ft tall, 100ft wide) with spiral towers around it. Hums low when sacrifices missed, ice vibrates. Makes wailing, musical sounds in wind. Fisherfolk say it sings to something deeper. Some towers appear humanoid/monstrous.

Awakened the lake monster. Is influenced by Zhent.

title: Tal-Kora the Black Shard (Bryn Shander)
description:
Symbol: Three-pointed spike. Black crystalline spire visible from city wall, looks like ancient guardian clawing up from underground. One of the few Auriliths that has NOT been proven to move at night. Threatens to emerge if sacrifices stop.


Tal-Kora the Black Shard exerts influence through constant surveillance and paranoia --the oppressive feeling of being watched. Bryn Shander residents report: shadows moving wrong, feeling eyes on them from empty windows, mirrors reflecting the Black Shard when it shouldn't be visible, and compulsive need to confess secrets or wrongdoings. Tal-Kora doesn't whisper demands - it creates overwhelming guilt and paranoia until people voluntarily confess crimes, turn in neighbors, or perform acts of penance. Those who resist the urge to 'come clean' begin seeing the Black Shard in reflections everywhere, growing larger and more threatening until they break. 

Sephek targets those who know they're being watched but refuse to submit to the judgment.

title: Chardalyn Corruption Network
description: If Regis's ruby is corrupted by chardalyn and used by Auril's servants, this creates a network of corrupted magic items. Could other legendary items in the region be similarly compromised? Connects to broader chardalyn themes in campaign.

title: Frozen Lake Aurilith Locations
description: Some Auriliths are half-submerged in frozen lakes around Ten Towns. These could be more dangerous/powerful, requiring ice traversal to investigate. Lake locations offer unique environmental challenges and potential for underwater sections if ice breaks.

title: Aurilith Encounter Mechanics
description: Auriliths have psychic whisper abilities (no sound, direct to mind/dreams). They move when not observed, change expressions subtly. Could create horror-style encounters where PCs notice changes but can't prove it. Potential for madness/paranoia effects.

title: Speakers vs Auriliths Power Dynamic
description: Town Speakers believe they are directing sacrifices to appease Auril, but the Auriliths are the true source of demands. Do the Speakers know? Are they complicit or being manipulated? This deception could create major political upheaval when revealed.

title: Sephek as Patron Identity Clue
description: Party discovering Sephek's true nature (undead possessed by frost spirit) will provide crucial clue about their patron Wynnette/Aiswyn's similar condition and true identity.

title: Zethryn Connection Mystery
description: Mysterious entity Zethryn contacted Joosep and provides divination through the Zethrynstone. Need to explore who/what Zethryn is and their agenda in the Dale.

title: Regis's Ruby - Corrupted by Chardalyn
description: Mythical tales of Regis's enchanted ruby being solution to winter curse. Rumored buried with him in Mithral Hall. Waylen believes freeing Icewind Dale could earn dwarf aid to petition for the ruby. Ruby rumors circulating among Kelvin's Cairn dwarves. TWIST: Ruby has been corrupted by chardalyn and is now being used by Auril's servants!

title: Skytower Shelter
description: Competitive goliath settlement in Spine of the World. Known for disliking strangers and taming griffons. Rival to another goliath settlement. Could be source of aerial reconnaissance or conflict.

title: Circle Shiverveil Hidden Settlements
description: Reclusive and secretive Firbolg clan locations. Bad reputation among regular Icewind Dale residents but respected by Reghed Nomads. Could be source of useful but dangerous knowledge.

title: Circle Blackgleam Territory
description: Firbolg clan territory with crystal caves they grow themselves. Clan specializes in crystal/ice magic and believes crystal manipulation is key to ending perpetual winter. Well-respected among those who know of them.

title: Waylen the Tall - Helm Cleric
description: Human Cleric of Helm (Matt). Motivations: protect weak, overcome personal failings, make a name. Seeks Regis Rumblebelly's enchanted ruby (rumored buried in Mithral Hall) as solution. Heard ruby rumors among dwarves at Kelvin's Cairn. Has weather-protection smoking pipe. +1 attitude bonus (people like Helm up North).

title: Keogr - Skytower Shelter Barbarian
description: Goliath Barbarian/Werebear (Kris). From Skytower Shelter - competitive goliath settlement in Spine of the World that dislikes strangers and tames griffons. SECRETLY AFFLICTED with lycanthropy (werebear). His clan sent him away on a quest to find Oyaminartok, the legendary Polar Werebear, believing this ancient werebear can teach him to control his curse. Special rage ability: icy focus state with auto rage damage but crits on 18-20. His lycanthropic condition may be connected to his unique rage mechanics - the 'icy focus' could be his attempt to suppress the bear's fury through cold discipline.

title: Joosep - Circle Shiverveil Ranger
description: Firbolg Ranger (Marvin). From Circle Shiverveil - particularly reclusive/secretive clan. Bad reputation among regular Icewind Dale folk, better reputation with Reghed Nomads. Contacted by Zethryn. Has Zethrynstone (ice sphere that can't melt, daily Augury from Zethryn's perspective).

title: Mama Chrys - Circle Blackgleam Druid
description: Firbolg Druid (Taylor). From Circle Blackgleam clan - holds crystals/ice in high regard, grows crystal caves. Clan believes manipulating crystals instrumental in lifting perpetual winter. Well respected among those who know them. Has Rimestone Salve special item.

title: Wynnette Rimevein (True Identity: Aiswyn)
description:
Party patron who head-hunted the team. Publicly wants to stop escalating sacrifices before total chaos. SECRETLY: Actually fae spirit Aiswyn, one of the 'watchers' who wants to defect. Tired of being glorified babysitter to mortals. Has ruby gem giving ambition to rise above deity. Wynnette is undead corpse possessed by frost spirit (like Sephek).

Air genasi woman appearing 60s, deathly pale skin (color of sun through glacier), lightning scar over left eye, long braided hair like woven scarf. Wears knucklehead scrimshaw flute around neck. Goal: guide party through tailored experiences to become heroes who can reverse the curse.

title: Escalating Sacrificial Practices
description: Ten Towns leaders making sacrifices to appease Auril. Citizens must spend new moon nights without heat/light. Monthly sacrifices of game and minerals left in cold. Rumors of humanoid sacrifices starting (unconfirmed but escalating).

title: Seven Auriliths - The True Watchers
description: Seven massive monolith structures (Auriliths) appeared last year - these are the REAL source of sacrifice demands, not town Speakers! Ominous forms that watch Dalefolk, some half-submerged in frozen lakes. Move subtly between visits, change expressions/positions without evidence. Whisper directly into thoughts/dreams (not through sound). Appear when sacrifices aren't made OR always watching?

title: Auril's Perpetual Winter
description: Icewind Dale frozen by Auril (NE goddess of cold, indifference, preservation). Temperature -49°F, constant howling winds, frequent blizzards. Sun only shines dimly 10am-2pm, otherwise dark except for aurora/full moon.

title: Oyaminartok - The Polar Werebear Legend
description: Ancient polar werebear of legendary status, rumored to dwell in the deepest reaches of Icewind Dale's wilderness. Known among northern tribes as the 'Ice Walker' or 'White Bear of the Endless Hunt.' Oyaminartok allegedly achieved perfect balance between human consciousness and bear instincts - neither fully human nor fully beast, but something greater. Keogr's clan believes finding this legendary figure is the only way for their exiled kinsman to master his lycanthropic curse.

title: Termalaine Mine - Chardalyn Corruption Site
description:
Former mining operation overrun by kobolds, but the true threat is chardalyn corruption. Miners unknowingly struck a vein of chardalyn ore, which began corrupting the kobold leader and driving the creatures mad with paranoia and aggression. The grell was attracted by the psychic emanations from the corrupted chardalyn. Ghost possession of kobold leader may be result of chardalyn's ability to thin the veil between life and death. Characters must decide whether to destroy the chardalyn (losing valuable resource), contain it, or find way to purify it. Connects to broader chardalyn corruption network affecting Ten-Towns.

Encounter: A Beautiful Mine

title: Corrupted Kobold Chieftain - Chardalyn Vessel
description:
Kobold leader possessed by ghost, but possession made possible by chardalyn corruption weakening his mind and spirit. The 'ghost' may actually be psychic echoes from the chardalyn itself - memories of those who died mining or handling the corrupted crystal. Speaks in multiple voices, sometimes coherent warnings about the 'black ice that watches,' other times ranting about ancient cold and endless winter. If freed from corruption, could provide valuable intelligence about chardalyn's effects and locations of other veins. Knowledge of underground tunnels that might connect to other corrupted sites.

Encounter: A Beautiful Mine

title: Sephek as Aurilith Enforcer - The Winter's Blade
description:
Sephek doesn't kill randomly - he targets individuals who defy specific Auriliths' psychic demands. When someone refuses an Aurilith's mental compulsions or challenges their authority, Sephek is dispatched as Auril's physical enforcer. Gorga refused Ishkar the Silver Mirror's demand to sacrifice something precious, so Sephek was sent to kill her. This creates a pattern: Auriliths psychically manipulate and test people, and those who resist face Sephek's ice daggers. Each murder location corresponds to someone who defied a specific Aurilith's will. The frost spirit inside Sephek can sense these acts of defiance across Ten-Towns, making him an extension of the Auriliths' influence.

title: Fear Rules - Aurilith Psychological Effects
description: Auriliths and their associated encounters can trigger fear effects beyond standard frightened condition. When exposed to Aurilith influence: WIS save DC 13-15 (varies by proximity/duration). Failure = frightened for 1 minute, can repeat save at end of each turn. Critical failure (natural 1) = additional effects: Tal-Kora causes paranoia (disadvantage on Insight checks for 24 hours), Ishkar causes mirror phobia (must save to look at reflective surfaces), Yll-Varn causes auditory hallucinations (hear phantom music). Repeated exposure increases DC by +1 per previous encounter. Characters with passive Insight 15+ notice when others are being psychically influenced. Calm Emotions ends most effects early. Fear immunity protects against basic frightened condition but not unique psychological effects.
